text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with salted caramel sauce that's
right i love hot fudge bucks in my
opinion the ultimate ice cream topping
is this salted caramel sauce it's
indescribably delicious and the good
news is it's so super simple to make
albeit slightly dangerous which just
adds the excitement so this is one of
those recipes you have to have
everything prepped and ready to go
before you start so you need some sugar
in a heavy heavy duty saucepan i'm using
cast iron you're also going to need some
heavy cream lots of butter that's why it
tastes good and then of course you can't
make salted caramel sauce without some
authentic French sea salts fleur de sel
as they say over there all right so all
that set and believe it or not that's
all you need so we're going to go over
to the stove and we're going to place
our heavy-duty
saucepan down on medium-high heat I'm
going to grab the kinky whisk I suggest
you have a plate next to your pot to put
your utensils down on since you don't
wanna be dripping molten sugar on your
stove and then all we're going to do is
stand there and wait for that sugar to
start melting all right and it's not
going to look like anything when you
start and like three minutes in you're
going to be like mmm this is weird
nothing's happening and then all of a
sudden check it out you'll see a little
darkness underneath the surface and it
will start to melt and when you see that
you just want to stir it and it's going
to look really weird and I don't make
caramel sauce that often but every time
I do when it gets to this stage I think
to myself man what did I do wrong I
totally screwed it up it's all chunky
but then you know what two minutes later
it starts to look like this and it
slowly turns into this gorgeous amber
color alright and you're going to keep
stirring until all the sugars melted and
at that point you're going to remove the
whisk and you're not going to put the
whisk back in until we start adding the
butter and cream all right so if you
want you can carefully give the pan a
little shake a little swirl every once
in a while and what we're waiting for is
the appropriate color and little faint
wisps of smoke so that kind of light
amber color is going to turn into a
darker amber like that and if you look
really closely you
see little tiny curls of smoke coming up
very very faint it's not smoking that
would be too far it's just thinking
about it now keep in mind the darker you
go with the sugar the more intense deep
caramel flavor you're going to get and
the less sweet your sauce will be so
right there is perfect at that point
we're going to turn off the heat turn
off the flame and I let mine sit there
for 30 seconds I just stare at it and
then I go ahead and throw in the butter
by the way this is much easier if you're
not trying to film it because you should
be whisking at this point but I was
doing something with my other hand with
the camera so you want to be whisking as
you're dumping your butter in and you
want to make sure you're using a
saucepan that's plenty big enough
because this can really bubble up and
foam up keep whisk and whisk and
whisking until the butter is gone and
then quickly and carefully pour in your
cream and do the same thing just whisk
it whisk it whisk it until everything is
perfectly combined and it should look
something like that and I'll just
reiterate the heat is off that is just
bubbling from that residual heat in the
sugar that stuff is so molten hot that's
why you got to be really careful with
this alright once that's all mixed in
the last ingredients a healthy pinch of
sea salt now you could just give it a
little pinch or you could give it a
couple pinches or in my case three nice
generous pinches and that's pretty much
it
so it's of course still very thin at
this point because it's still molten hot
but let's switch to a spatula here and
you can see as it cools it gets
unbelievably gorgeous sexy shiny and
amazing I wish I could have worked in
